intro: Pentacaena tenuior, commonly known as the slender pentacaulon, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color, arranged in whorls along the stem. It is adapted to survive in dry conditions, with a deep root system and reduced leaf surface to minimize water loss. Pentacaena tenuior is often found in rocky soils and is a component of the vegetation in savanna and shrubland ecosystems.
